intro: Leptodactylon californicum var. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular leathery fern, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to California. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its leathery, dark green fronds with a distinctive glandular texture on the underside. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its spores are produced in sori that are clustered on the undersides of the fronds. This variant is distinguished by its glandular structures, which contribute to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations.
